meanings.definition: A person who signals or calls someone to come closer.
meanings.sent1: The beckoner waved to his friend to come over.
meanings.sent2: The beckoner at the party was standing near the entrance, motioning for guests to join.
meanings.sent3: The beckoner playfully danced around, trying to get the attention of his friends.
meanings.sent4: The beckoner in the crowd was like a lighthouse guiding lost ships to safety.
meanings.sent5: The beckoner's bright smile and enthusiastic gestures made it easy to spot him in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To signal or call someone to come closer.
meanings.sent1: She beckoned her dog to come inside with a whistle.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide beckoned the group to follow him to the next exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The cat beckoned to its owner with a soft meow, wanting attention.
meanings.sent4: The flickering light beckoned travelers to the cozy inn on the hill.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread beckoned customers into the bakery.
